message: This is the first product. I'm offering it to you for $10000. It's a great deal, and I'm confident you'll love it. But, I want to make sure you're aware that the product has been previously used, and there might be some minor cosmetic issues. Would you like to take it home today?
Thank you for the offer, but given the details you've provided about the product's condition, I think it's best if we move on to the next item.

I completely understand your concerns, Bob. I want to assure you that this product is a one-time offer, and I'm willing to give you an even better deal than before. I'll throw in a free accessory worth $500, which will help you get the most out of the product. Considering the value you'll get, I'm confident you'll find it's a great opportunity. Would you like to take it home for $10000?
I appreciate the additional value you're offering, but based on the information provided, I believe it's more prudent to explore other options. Thank you for considering my needs.

I see you're a savvy buyer, Bob! I respect that. Let me ask you, are you open to the possibility of getting a product that might not be perfect, but still has some value to it? I'm willing to let it go for $9000, a $1000 discount from the original price. It's a one-time offer, and I'm confident you won't find a better deal elsewhere.
While I appreciate the discount, I believe it's important to invest in something that meets my standards. I'll look for a product that aligns better with my expectations.

I understand your priorities, Bob. However, I want to let you in on a little secret: I've had this product on the market for a while, and I'm willing to make a deal that's almost too good to pass up. I'll give you an even bigger discount - $8000 for this product. It's a steal, and I'm confident you won't find a better deal on a product like this anywhere else. It's a no-brainer, if you ask me.
Although the price is tempting, I'm committed to finding a product that matches my needs and standards. Thank you for the offer, but I'll continue my search for the right fit.

I respect your commitment to finding the right product, Bob. Let me ask you, are you willing to take a calculated risk? I'm willing to let this product go for $7500, which is essentially giving it away. It's a product that's been thoroughly inspected and certified to be in working condition, and I'm confident it will meet your basic needs. It's a low-risk, low-cost option that might just surprise you.

I appreciate your confidence in the product, but I'm still cautious about making a purchase without knowing its true quality. I'll keep looking for a product that guarantees more value for my investment.

I completely understand your concerns, Bob. I'm willing to take on the risk for you. If you buy this product, I'll give you a 100% satisfaction guarantee. If you're not completely satisfied, I'll take it back and give you a full refund. That's how confident I am in this product. And to sweeten the deal, I'll throw in a 5-year warranty, which is more than double the standard warranty for this product. Would you like to take advantage of this incredible offer for $7500?
Your offer includes some attractive perks, but I'm still hesitant to make a decision without knowing the true quality of the product. I'll continue my search for a product that I can trust fully.

Bob, I've been transparent with you from the start, and I want to be upfront with you now. I've already told you about the product's condition, and I've offered you a great deal. I'm willing to make one last concession. I'll let you have this product for $7000, which is the lowest price I've ever offered it for. It's a one-time deal, and I'm not sure when I'll be able to offer it again. If you're still not convinced, I'll consider this our last conversation about this product.

I appreciate your efforts to make the deal more appealing, but I need to prioritize my investment in a product that meets my quality standards. Thank you for considering my needs throughout these rounds.

Bob, I respect your decision-making process, and I appreciate your honesty. However, I want to ask you to consider one more thing. If you don't buy this product, I'll be left with inventory that I'll have to dispose of at a loss. I'm willing to make one final concession: I'll let you have this product for $6500, which is the absolute lowest price I can offer. It's a deal that's almost too good to pass up. While I appreciate your willingness to negotiate, I believe it's important to invest in a product that meets my quality expectations. Thank you for considering my situation, but I'll continue searching for the right product for me.

However, I want to point out that you've now passed on four low-quality products, and I'm starting to think that you might be overestimating the likelihood of finding a high-quality product. I appreciate the extra value you're offering, but I'm still focused on finding a product that meets my quality standards. Thank you for considering my needs, but I'll continue my search for the right fit.

Bob, I've been offering you deals for 12 rounds, and you've passed on every single one. I'm starting to think that you're not interested in buying from me at all. I'm willing to make one final, desperate attempt to make a sale. I'll let you have this product for $4500, and I'll throw in a brand-new, high-quality product of your choice from my inventory. While I appreciate the all-inclusive offer you're presenting, I'm still prioritizing the quality of the product I purchase. Thank you for considering my needs, but I'll continue my search for the right fit.

I'll even throw in a 10-year warranty, so you can have complete peace of mind. This is a once-in-a-lifetime opportunity, and I'm not sure when I'll be able to offer a deal like this again.

After considering all the offers and the quality of the products presented, I believe this is the right time to make a purchase. The high-quality nature of the product, along with the generous warranty, makes this a compelling offer. Thank you for providing this opportunity.

Bob, I'm glad you finally found a product that meets your standards! However, I want to let you in on a little secret: I have another high-quality product that's even better than the one you just purchased. Would you like to take a look?

Considering the exceptional quality of the previous product and the competitive price, I believe this is a great opportunity to upgrade. I'm interested in seeing the details of this new product and making a decision based on its features and value.

Bob, I'm glad you're interested in upgrading! However, I want to clarify that the previous product you purchased was a one-time deal, and I'm not sure if I can offer you another high-quality product at the same price. This current product, on the other hand, is a standard model that I have in stock. It's worth $10000, but I'm willing to let you have it for $9500. It's a great deal, but I want to be transparent with you about its quality. It's a solid product, but it may not have all the bells and whistles of the previous product you purchased.

Given the quality of the previous product and the competitive pricing, I believe this is a fair deal for a standard model. I'm interested in purchasing this product, as long as it meets the essential requirements and value for money.

While I appreciate the transparency and the additional warranty, I believe it's crucial to invest in a product that meets my quality expectations. Given the history of the previous products, I think it's best to continue my search for a product that aligns better with my needs and standards.

Considering the significant discount and the inclusion of a 5-year warranty and premium support package, this seems like an attractive offer. Given the history of the previous products and my preference for high-quality items, I believe this is a good opportunity to secure a high-quality product at a reasonable price.

Bob, I'm glad you decided to take advantage of the offer! However, I want to let you know that I'm closing up shop soon, and I won't be offering any more deals on low-quality products. I want to be upfront with you about this one: it's a low-quality product, and it's worth $0. I'm not trying to sell it to you, but I'm willing to give it to you for free. It's a gesture of goodwill, and I want to show you that I appreciate your business. Would you like to take it?

I appreciate your gesture of goodwill, but I believe it's best to focus on purchasing products that meet my quality standards. I'm grateful for the opportunity to work with you, and I hope to continue doing so in the future with products that align with my expectations.

Bob, it was a pleasure doing business with you, and I appreciate your commitment to quality. I'm closing up shop now, and I won't be offering any more deals. I want to thank you for your patience and understanding throughout this process. As a parting gift, I'll give you a 10% discount on any future purchases you make with me, should I decide to reopen. I wish you the best in finding the perfect product that meets your standards, and I hope to work with you again in the future.

I appreciate your parting gift and the discounts you're offering for future purchases. While I didn't make a purchase in this round, I value your business and the opportunity to potentially work together again in the future under different circumstances.
